  76. I have terrible eczema on my hands and every lotion/cream/body butter/oil I had tried would burn like lemon on a paper cut. No longer! This goes on smoothly, pain-free, and my hands are doing better than they have in years. This was my first experience with raw shea butter, so I was unsure what to expect. It did take me a bit of trial and error to figure out how to apply the stuff. The consistency is a bit crumbly, similar to play-doh, and I had no idea how big of a chunk to use. Now, I would say dime size works well for just my hands and maybe half-dollar if I am doing a full body slather. I found that warming it briefly between my hands allowed it to melt a bit and spread more easily on my skin. Once you start working it into your skin it melts beautifully. Also, it is essentially an oil, so it does not absorb into skin the way a lotion will. It has met my needs well, and I am very happy with this product.

My skin feels great, and some dry areas are healing quickly after consistent use. I've thrown away all my expensive serums and used this butter on my face almost exclusively. The texture was extremely grainy, color was more on the light brown and the smell was overpowering, to the point that the trial formulas I did for soaps and lotions could not eliminate the bad smell and the grainy feeling made it nearly impossible to scoop it out. Not easy butter style as I was expecting. I probably used 2 ounces of it in the trials, but will not be using it anymore in production formulas.

  240. So after some research on Shea Butter, the white Shea is true Shea. The yellow is actually from a completely different tree, but it's still good stuff. This is 100% true raw Shea. It comes in the bag shown, and is the brick of Shea wrapped in plastic as shown.<br /><br />I use it as a moisturizer when my skin is particularly needy. To use it, I put a small amount in my hand and rub it around to warm it up/melt it enough to rub on smoothly. I put it on my body at night and let my skin soak it up, otherwise I'm feel a little greasy during the day. Perhaps the yellow shea butter is different, but I definitely would not purchase the ivory butter again, and I am now reluctant to buy raw shea butter over the internet at all - I want to be able to smell it before purchasing it.

My only downfall with the product, hence 4 stars is that u can only buy it in 1lb blocks and I would like to buy in bulk, so I may continue to look elsewhere for a quality shea Butter in bulk. It takes a while for the shea butter to melt into my skin, but the results are divine! My skin has never felt so luscious or moisturized.   473. Awesome Shea Butter. I have used it twice once for some eye cream and then lotion. The only thing I can say or recommend is not using it in the morning on your face, it does leave a greasy feel. It may be my recipe that is the problem and haven't tried a new one yet. Lotion is great and don't have that problem. Great feel and super easy to use. I didn't have a double broiler, so I used a pot and then a glass Pyrex round bowl that would fit on top of the pot nicely. Fill the pot with water a 1/4 of the way up, you don't want the bowl to touch the water. Stick the amount you need to melt in the glass bowl and set on top till it melts. After that take off and let cool on a hot pad, follow your recipe directions to water ever you are doing to know how far to let cool. The eye cream and lotion I made came out like whipped butter. Super easy.<br />They even have some nice recipes on line for you to try that are free.
  474. Purchased this product to make moisturizing lotion and use to condition my curly dry hair. the product arrived promptly, in excellent shape and melted smoothly when rubbed on skin. It is oily but quickly is absorbed in skin. If you do not like the smell of organic shea butter, this can easily be resolved by combining it with Cocoa butter and almond oil. Great product!

The recipes are very easy to prepare. The ingredients are easy to obtain and easy to use.* I purchased most of my ingredients on Amazon because they are often less expensive than one might find in local stores (essential oils tend to run high and, through Amazon, I can still support small businesses even though they might not be local). All in all, this is a great product, the recipes are excellent (clean, simple and very nice to use once prepared), and the seller/contact person is friendly, informative and interactive. She will be selling other products soon and I highly recommend purchasing products from her.<br /><br />*A suggestion regarding beeswax: I purchased mine in brick form and though it smells wonderful and is a very good product, it was extremely hard and therefore difficult tocut and measure. While shopping, I noticed that some sellers offer it in bead or pellet form. Next time I need some, I am going to purchase it in that form as it will make handling and measuring much easier and much more accurate. Beeswax is also very messy and difficult to clean away once it cools/hardens. Just a suggestion to keep this in mind when using it.

This is great for sensitive and non-sensitive people alike, because it has a very nice earthy pleasant smell, not strong at all (not like the yellow Shea butter. Yellow butter is still good but I think it's for people with intense skin issues, because it is /extremely/ moisturizing and oily. This butter is VERY rich still but not as greasy and actually after about 15-20 minutes absorbs completely.<br /><br />I put it on after shower, hang out for 20 minutes with a cup of coffee, and then get to touching 'mechanical' things. I wouldn't advise picking up your laptop immediately after application since it takes about that 20 minutes. Fast shipping and great customer service. The yellow butter I got from a different company I don't remember whom.. but I these people are better. This butter never went bad after 6 months. The other butter went bad about 3-4 months later... moldy. This time I'm keeping it in the fridge too so it should last me a whole year. A year of lotions taken care of is a great deal for this price and quality. Recommended.

It is non-comedogenic meaning it does not clog pores or cause acne, and it is a great moisturizer especially for winter time.<br /><br />The smell is light, and the consistency is less grainy than the previous shea butter I tried from Amazon. It does have a smell, however, and this is normal for undefined shea butter, which retains more of its healthy healing vitamins and nutritional value.<br /><br />We mix the shea butter with hemp seed oil, which is also a non-comedogenic oil, to loosen the consistency and make it easier to apply. I also do another mixture with zinc oxide powder (also by the same seller) as sunscreen. Extremely versatile as a base ingredient for homemade skincare products.

  765. At first I was leery about buying this product because of the reviews. Yes, they were mostly good but then some where just awful and I didn't want to fall into the trap of ignoring the warnings in favor of positive news. I end up giving this product a chance because it said exactly what I was looking for in a Shea Butter product. I didn't want it fully diluted with other products or grainy or yellow or foul smelling. Plus for 16 dollars for a pound is a good deal when other companies sell lower quality for much more.<br /><br />Before shipment i received a nice letter, I'm not sure if it was automatic (pretty sure it was) but it was lovely anyhow to be noticed as a customer and to know the company appreciated my purchase.<br /><br />Shipping - I bought it on a Friday and received it on a Wednesday of the follow week. I might have gotten it sooner if it wasn't for the weekend, however, its still fast shipping compared to the almond oil I am still waiting on, the one I paid shipping on where as this came with free shipping and still got to me in under a week. Keep in mind, I live in the States in the Midwest so people further out or not in the country might have a different shipping speed.<br /><br />Packaging - The box itself came with another package so I can't say anything on the package stand alone. As for the image promoted. It looks exactly as the picture, same brown resealable package with a pound Shea Butter in plastic resealable baggie which is excellent because you can take out the product without messing up the brown pack, your hands, or product itself.<br /><br />Shea Butter - Its ivory white, none grainy, looks like a mix between play-dough and butter. It feels smooth to the touch and breaks apart fairly easy. In MY patch (which could be different for everyone else) in a small dime size amount, it only two about 5-6 seconds for it to melt from my body temperature and my average body temp is between 96-98 degrees U.S. The Shea Butter itself is soft enough to scoop out easily with a spoon, even a plastic one and I could mix a palm size amount with essential and other oils without heating it up first which is again; excellent, because I can make homemade body butters without going through the traditional methods of a double boiler. This also means unlike the boiler method you have to be very careful of the amount of oils the Shea Butter gets mixed into because it can easily become borderline Shea 'liquid'..unless you are making a shampoo, that's good too! Thankfully! This order does come with a recipe book the you have to DL online if you are into the type of DIY like myself. The smell of the Shea butter is earthy clay, some people might not like this, some people do, but you can add fragrance and the 'Shea' smell will tone down but not completely go away.<br /><br />Overall - Keep in mind as much as I praise this product and will most likely buy more in the future. I do have to add this product is not for everyone. If your skin/hair type doesn't absorb well, or you have very sensitive skin/hair, or skin/hair sucks up a lot of moisture (like my hair).... this product is not for you. Rather, I should say; buy this product will full intent on making the Shea Butter part of a larger blend or you will find yourself disappointed. Personally, I enjoy the Shea Butter, my mother enjoys it, and as I said, I will be buying from this company again.<br /><br />If 16 dollars (or whatever the price change will be by the time anyone reads this) is not going to break your wallet and you do want a good Shea Butter product, definitely consider trying this one out.<br /><br />I hope this review helps!h to scoop out easily with a spoon, even a plastic one and I could mix a palm size amount with essential and other oils without heating it up first which is again; excellent, because I can make homemade body butters without going through the traditional methods of a double boiler. This also means unlike the boiler method you have to be very careful of the amount of oils the Shea Butter gets mixed into because it can easily become borderline Shea 'liquid'..unless you are making a shampoo, that's good too! Thankfully! This order does come with a recipe book the you have to DL online if you are into the type of DIY like myself. The smell of the Shea butter is earthy clay, some people might not like this, some people do, but you can add fragrance and the 'Shea' smell will tone down but not completely go away.<br /><br />Overall - Keep in mind as much as I praise this product and will most likely buy more in the future. I do have to add this product is not for everyone. If your skin/hair type doesn't absorb well, or you have very sensitive skin/hair, or skin/hair sucks up a lot of moisture (like my hair).... this product is not for you. In responses to those that stay they never received the recipes. The recipes DO NOT COME WITH THE PRODUCT. You have to download the pdf. I haven't used the recipes because I have my own but they look to be a really good starting point for those that want to make their own beauty products and don't know where to start.<br /><br />Now about the shea butter. I took less than dime size amount and rubbed it in between my palms and it was kind of like a hair pomade consistency because it melted but didn't disappear or melt completely into an oily mess. I rubbed it into my skin and my skin absorbed it nicely and it felt nice not sticky or oily. Now when I put a lot more on my sons eczema spots and at first it was a little oily but then his skin absorbed completely it and seemed to need more. After a couple uses I thought that it wasn't working on him. It's like his skin was drinking it in but I continued to use it because it made my skin feel lovely. So a little less than a week went by and I started to see that the skin underneath his dry eczema skin was healing beautifully. It's been 2 weeks and the skin underneath is completely healed but he still has dry dead skin on top which I lightly rub off with a very soft wash cloth after his bath. I apply the Sheabutter about 3-4 times a day. We use a very small amount on our very curly hair and it leaves it nice and soft. We are a natural chemical free family and this shea butter is now something we cannot live without. I'll be ordering from this company for life!<br /><br />UPDATE!   806. This Shea butter wasn't white, but more of an off-white or ivory color. It came in a bag that was brown paper on the outside with a zip closure. The butter itself is sealed in an interior plastic wrap.<br />It's texture reminds me a bit of cookie dough with a twist. It feels like pure Shea butter. It is sort of hard but as it is handled or manipulated it morphs into a somewhat soft and at times liquid or oily form<br />I wanted a super moisturizer/treatment for eczema without preservatives and found several recipes. I did not want anything was heated. I wanted to formulate a small batch that was whipped.<br />I combined the Shea butter with wheat germ oil as well as a couple fragrant essential oils. I cut the ingredients into the butter and then used my hand mixer and whipped it together for a few minutes. I packed the entire mix into a 4 oz. Ball glass jar and popped it into the fridge. The mix isn't quite as hard as most Shea butter mixes. It is somewhat pliant and sort of liquifies as it is applied. While it is a little greasy, when it is applied to the skin it absorbs easily. In the morning my skin was super soft and seemed firmer. The dry crusty skin from the eczema didn't disappear immediately. It gradually disappeared and healed over a four day period.<br />Since I haven't used unrefined organic Shea Butter before I can only speak of this experience. I thought this product was great. It was easy to use and it was clear of particles and visible impurities.<br />I chose this particular brand because of all the positive Amazon reviews that this was a superior product when compared to other shea butters. And I've had skin that could easily break out with most moisturizers, including jojoba oil.<br />Apparently shea butter is a ZERO on the comedogenic scale of 0 to 5 (coconut oil is a 4 which explains to me why it clogged my pores and broke me out every time I tried to use it). I was a bit wary to use it on my face, but I can now say after use for a couple of weeks that I had no breakout at all, and my skin is looking wonderful - I especially love using it as an eye cream. It really improves the skin around the eye area and doesn't irritate my eyes, unlike the many expensive eye creams I've used, which did jack s*** for my eye area. This makes my skin healthy. It heals cuts and wounds. It is great for hands, feet, everything, and ALL natural. I don't like the recipes to add it to coconut oil because for me, coconut oil just cheapens the wonderful rich shea quality. I mixed it with lavender essential oil and use it as my face and eye cream. Totally will buy this again.<br />The free ebook comes as soon as you enter the confirmation code from your order, so it was prompt. While I didn't use all the recipes, it's nice to have some guides on how to mix it up. I will use it with many essential oils for various uses.<br />Great product, great service. I do wish it was a little less expensive, but other than that, 5 stars!<br /><br />UPDATE JULY 30, 2015<br />I'm pregnant with our first baby (30 weeks - over 7 months) and used this as a pure moisturizer throughout, it has worked nicely, still never causes any breakouts either. I use it on my belly, and any areas where women get stretch marks, after every shower. So far, my skin is supple and never has itched (I hear many pregnant women get itchy skin on their bellies because the skin is stretching). I make sure to drink lots of water and use my shea butter on my skin, and have felt quite comfortable, so I like this a lot. I've already ordered a couple of times, and will certainly order again.   972. Bought this late last October and my experience with the Shea Butter has been without ANY complaints. It was shipped promptly, arrived exactly as pictured (small brown bag with the Shea in it), and the actual butter itself is of great quality (as far as I can tell, anyways.)<br /><br />I've been using yellow Shea for about a year or two now, and while it has worked wonders for my face in combination with African Black soap, the yellow shea butter always felt heavier on my face; even though it would melt fairly easily, it never truly seemed to absorb into my skin, which would frequently leave my face uncomfortably oily. I more or less coped with it over the past couple years, but I finally decided to buy this Ivory Shea to change it up a bit, and I'm really glad I did. It melts ridiculously fast when you rub it in between your fingertips, and it also absorbs into the skin quickly, without even clogging my pores up! Being that Shea butter is naturally oily, this Ivory Shea has still left my skin oily from time to time, but I mostly blame that on myself for applying too much, or even not applying it evenly on my face. This truly leaves the skin moisturized and soft, and I hope this seller never stops selling this Shea!<br /><br />As you can tell, I'm using the butter simply to moisturize my face, and not much else. I don't use this for my hair, and I also don't even care about the scent (which I truly find to be faint -- its definitely there, but it doesn't linger nor does it even fill a room up with its scent.) As my daily face moisturizer, this Shea butter does a superb job of keeping my face moisturized and smooth, which is all I ask for.

  1039. Prior to purchasing this, I had only ever used the yellow shea butter by a different company. While waiting for this one to arrive I bought a tiny jar of the white butter at Whole Foods because I was completely out. While I like the other brand, I absolutely LOVE Better Shea Butter's brand; it is not whipped (the Whole Foods brand was) and was soft, pliable, easy to apply to my skin. Sometimes I get excited when I get a new product and tend to use too much, so I took it easier with this and it paid off. I only use a small amount for skin moisturization and it does moisturize superbly.<br /><br />I will admit to a rather complicated skin care routine as I am a product junkie, but here is what I do to keep my body smooth and soft: argan oil goes on my skin first thing after a shower, then shea butter, then Kiehl's body lotion. I have experimented with various butters and oils; coconut oil (too greasy and does not absorb well), avocado butter (good, but greasier than shea), cocoa butter (very greasy but does the job), sesame oil (terrible, does not absorb at all and leaves skin strangely dry beneath the oil), olive oil (will do in a pinch when I am out of argan oil). But shea butter is my all-time favorite because it has a bit of sun protection in it - my fair skin does not burn but turns a nice golden color.<br /><br />All that said, I didn't know what I was missing by using the yellow butter rather than the white! The texture is smoother and does not harden even in my air-conditioned house. It absorbs into the skin even better than the yellow and this brand better than the other white butter I bought (AAA brand). It is a massive amount that I am sure will take me through the summer. And even though temperatures here in the South are in the upper 80s right mow, this chunk-o-butter arrived only soft, not melted though it had been on a carrier vehicle all day. It would have even been okay with me if it were melted but nice that it wasn't.<br /><br />I had some pesky dry skin flaking off my legs (why is it that legs dry out more than arms even when less exposed to the elements? One of life's mysteries...). Even with exfoliation and my meticulous skin care routine the condition persisted. However, this shea butter has significantly reduced the problem with just two applications and I fully expect it to be \\"cured\\" with several more uses. This is real shea butter, folks - the best I've used. The price is actually a steal too.<br /><br />I can't comment on use for hair or face. My hair is too fine to withstand heavy oils and butters but I bet that someone with thicker or more coarse hair would benefit greatly from it. My skin is pretty oily right now so I can only see myself using it there in the wintertime when skin is drier.<br /><br />I am greatly impressed with this company's customer service. Isabella has been right on top of things with personal emails thanking me for my order and information on downloading recipes. That she has taken time to do this with each and every person who places an order speaks volumes about her business ethic. I had pored over the reviews for this shea butter as well as other brands and was satisfied that all the reviews were genuine. She also responded to the few negative reviews with grace. I would give 5 stars based on my first order of this product back in Feb 2015. But my second order this month has been so bad that I have to give an overall rating of 2...I hate leaving bad reviews on a whim, but my experiences are so vastly different:( I first ordered the Better Shea Butter &#34;100% Unrefined Organic Shea Butter - African Grade A Ivory&#34; back in Feb 2015. The product arrived in a brown bag, in which the butter was placed in a ziplock bag. I loved the packaging. The product also was an off yellow color and had a very nice, pleasant, mildly nutty smell (almost a bit like a very pleasant and light licorice smell). The product was smooth was no grainy or rough texture. I liked it so much I then re-ordered the product earlier this month. I was going to write a review after finishing the first pack but then thought perhaps I should wait to see how my second experience is with this product. I'm so glad I did because I am SO disappointed with what I received. First off, the re-order product was not in a ziplock, but rather in a regular plastic that when opened could NOT be resealed. Secondly, and worst of all, the product smells terrible - it smells like burned rubber...i dont know what exactly but &#34;burned&#34; is the definite vibe! It is so off putting even my boyfriend has commented on how bad it is. To add insult to injury, the product is very grainy in texture and not smooth at all. Also, the color is more grey than yellow. I am utterly confused about the inconsistent packaging as well as the inconsistent (and in my opinion), inferior quality of the second order. Why has the color changed from pale yellow/cream to greyish cream?? Why has the smell become so pungent and unpleasant? Why is the packaging not in ziplock? Why is the texture now rough and grainy?? From what I see on Amazon reviews, it seems my second order matches complaints other customers had, which then seemed to be improved upon, resulting in the improved packaging changing to ziplock and the product smell and texture being improved on...so have I received an old batch of the previous product before improvement????? If this were how it always smelled and felt, then I would not complain, but there is a vast difference between the two orders...this product has been the only thing that works for me (keeping breakouts away, skin smooth and well nourished)....and even though I like it, the negative factors right now make it very difficult for me to even use the product (the smell and texture especially) As said, I will update my review when I hear from the seller

  1111. I was very interested in this product since I had in the past purchase Shea butters products, but they all came with a sent that I was not to crazy about and other list of ingredients. So I decided to try the 100% real stuff and I made an incredible lotion not only for me, but for my daughters. And believe me making it your self there is nothing in comparison. I did mix it with real 100% raw cocoa butter and some coconut oil and some essential oils of my liking and those of my daughters liking as well and wow! Our skin felt like it had never had before loved it!!! Will always purchase from this vender I had a problem and she quickly took care of it very kind and gracious. Here is the lotion I made my daughters. Have fun!!!!<br /><br />Mint Chocolate Whipped Body Butter<br />Ingredients:<br /><br />1/2 cup of organic cocoa butter (where to find cocoa butter)<br />1/2 cup organic shea butter. You can also substitute another 1/2 cup cocoa butter. It will be a smidge less \\"light\\" when whipped up, but it is amazing! (where to find organic mango butter, where to find shea butter)<br />1/2 cup coconut oil (find coconut oil here)<br />1/2 cup of jojoba or a mild olive oil. Almond oil can also be used but it will decrease shelf life because it is more vulnerable to oxidation. (Find jojoba oil here)<br />1-2 teaspoons peppermint essential oil, depending on preference (where to find peppermint essential oil)<br />2 tablespoons pure cocoa or cacao powder. If you would prefer a \\"white chocolate\\" version that is not a bronzer, substitute arrowroot powder or non-GMO cornstarch. (Where to find cacao powder, where to find arrowroot powder, where to find non-GMO cornstarch)<br />2 teaspoons naturally derived vitamin E, optional (Where to find naturally derived, non-GMO vitamin E)<br />How To Make Whipped Body Butter:<br /><br />Prepare an ice bath by filling a large bowl with ice and fitting a smaller bowl inside. The inside bowl needs to be able to hold at least 4-5 cups of liquid.<br />Using a double boiler or a pot of boiling water with a smaller pot fitted inside, melt cocoa butter and mango butter over a low simmer.<br />Add coconut oil and melt until completely liquid.<br />Remove cocoa butter/coconut oil mixture from heat.<br />Measure 5 teaspoons of cocoa powder into a small bowl and gradually add several tablespoons of jojoba/almond/olive oil. Mix thoroughly and then add to cocoa butter/coconut oil mixture along with remaining jojoba/almond/olive oil.<br />Place mixture in chilled bowl (which should still be resting above the ice bowl) and allow to cool for 10 minutes.<br />Remove mixture from ice bath and whip until stiff peaks form. If after a few minutes it does not seem to be thickening return the bowl to the ice bath and whip there.<br />Store in an airtight jar - Amber or cobalt are best but a clear jar is fine if kept out of direct sunlight (which promotes oxidation).

  1171. OK, so I bought this stuff because it looked delicious. No, I'm not going to eat it, but the photos of it looking like fudge just make it so appealing, am I right? You just want to take a bite out of it. It's actually edible, but my guess is it doesn't taste as good as it looks.<br /><br />This stuff has a consistency similar to raw cookie dough. The photos are accurate. I chose ivory because I read that ivory shea butter is higher quality, which I can't confirm. When I first got it, I was impressed by the substantial feel and weight; I could tell right away that I have a lot of shea butter here, especially since I plan to use it straight as a moisturizer.<br /><br />To use it, I remove a tiny piece, and I do mean tiny. At first I made the mistake of using a piece about the size of a nickel, and it covered my hands in a thick sheen of oil that I had to wash off. Way too much. Now, I use a piece maybe the size of a pea to do my entire face. It does not go on like regular lotion: you need to warm it a bit before it spreads, which takes maybe 10 seconds, and even then you need to use more force than lotion to spread it around. Sometimes I rub it between my fingers or in my palm, and sometimes I just press a little piece against my face and work it around, letting my face melt it. Ha, face melt. Anyhoo...<br /><br />This stuff is an ingredient in many, if not most of the quality moisturizers on the market, and I'm starting to think that there are only a few key ingredients in moisturizers that really do anything and could work just fine on their own, but moisturizers blend in a bunch of filler ingredients to make it easier to use and save on cost. Shea is one of these, so I figure why not cut out all the filler and use the active ingredient straight? I don't know how accurate my speculation is, but I do know that this stuff moisturizes skin, and does it well. You have to work it in and be careful not to use too much, just enough so you can feel it on the skin. In about10 minutes, unless you used too much, it absorbs into the skin, leaving behind a slight sheen that is more matte than many moisturizers I've used. It lasts a long time, too, keeping my skin soft most of the day. Allegedly shea is a natural UV inhibitor, which if true is a nice bonus, but I don't know what sort of SPF it achieves if so.<br /><br />The smell is not wonderful, but not bad. It smells a little like slightly rotten vegetables, but not in an overly imposing way, it's very subtle (I have to practically stick my nose up to it to really smell it) and the smell can not be detected once it absorbs, at least not per my experience.<br /><br />I wound up giving chunks of it to friends, and everyone has been impressed with it. At the rate I use it, this brick of shea would last a lifetime. I think it would be fun to use it as a base for making my own moisturizer, adding stuff like essential oil and food coloring maybe. Actually, I've heard that people use it as cooking oil, but I'm not sure that appeals to me.
  1172. The ivory Shea butter is awesome and my wife loves it. I absolutely recommend this to anyone seeking a quality topical moisturizer without all the chemicals!
  1173. I have a hard time with synthetic fragrance but natural scents(essential oils and such) have not made me sick. After much reading and reviewing I decided to give it a go and ordered some. I was pleasantly surprised when I received it. It was very soft and the scent was not strong or overwhelming at all like others have said. It was very earthy and nutty and did not make me sick to my stomach. I rather liked the smell and so did my teenage step daughter. I don't smell like it at all when I wake up though.<br /><br />I'm liking it so far, doesn't hurt to try. However, prepare yourself a wide mouth jar for this product so you aren't having to keep it in the bag it was first sealed in.<br /><br />Hope this helps!
  1388. This is good stuff. Everything about it seems authentic. Used it to make my all organic hair serum/pomade. Turned out great and my hair is coming back to life. it can be used on your skin straight up as a lotion.

  1391. First off let me say that I've been getting my Shea butter from my local hair supply store, needless to say I won't be getting the yellow, greasy \\"Shea butter\\" from there anymore! I love making my own hair and skin products and Better Shea Butter its the only place I'll get my Shea butter from now on. I did some research and found out that Shea butter is supposed to have an ivory or beige color to it and it's supposed to have the consistency of something along the lines of play dough but a little bit softer and those two things is what I found when I ordered my butter from Better Shea Butter.The butter came in a plastic bag that was packaged in a nice little brown paper bag to block light from ruining the butter(how smart, right)! Plus the paper bag was resealable(again, smart right). The butter was easy to handle not too hard but not too soft which made it just right for melting. Overall my experience with the Better Shea Butter company was great! But you know what made it even better? The owner sent me a thank you card for buying her product! Thanking ME! I should be thanking her for making such a good product! You should buy from Better Shea Butter not only do they have a FANTASTIC product but they also know how to treat their customers!!!

  1497. I am very pleased with my shea butter purchase. The product arrived as a slab packed in a double zip-lock bag, so it survived rough handling very well. Although the butter was solid, I was able to cut through it easily with a butter knife in order to place the pieces in several containers. Its faint scent and ivory color are a strong indicator that the butter is unrefined. Because it stays solid at room temperature, it was hard for me to soften some of it in my palms. Therefore, I used a knife to scrape a little bit off its surface, this way it was much easier for me to soften it so I could spread it over my legs. The legs shined only for the first 20 minutes, then the gloss was gone and the skin felt velvety to the touch. I used the butter for my acne-prone face as well, and next morning the skin was very soft and had that satin feel to it. I was a bit apprehensive before putting the butter on my face because my face is very sensitive to any facial products, but it liked the shea butter. I will continue to use it because I am very inspired with the results of my first days of shea butter usage. I recommend it to others.

  1527. Here's my recipe: 4 parts shea butter melted in microwave. Monitor closely so shea butter does not burn. When partially cool, add 1 part extra virgin olive oil. Beat with mixer until fully incorporated. Pour into glass container with lid. My mixture did get hard again, so I melted it for easy application. I can not tell you how wonderfully soft it has made my dry skin. Essential oils, NOT fragrance oils could be added if aroma is desired. I love it and will continue to try new formulas.

  1734. Comes packaged as shown. The big difference between this and several other brands/types of Shea butter (which I have purchased and used) is that this is very soft. It is not hard and crumbly, as many are; it is not grainy, as most are; it is not pre-whipped and full of air, as some are. This is a wonderful product and very easy to use. However, if you have used other Shea butter in the past in various recipes, whether lip balm or hand lotion, be aware that you may need to alter your recipes slightly if you use this product. Because it is naturally soft instead of hard and crumbly, your finished product will also be softer. This is not a bad thing! For my lip balms I simply increased the amount of beeswax in the recipe and for my Shea lotion I added a little &#34;hard&#34; butter (like mango or cocoa) so the consistency would turn out more firm at the end. If you're just making a whipped body butter you shouldn't need to alter the recipe. Oh, I should mention that the scent is mild and pleasant. Some kinds of Shea can be on the stinky side but both times I've purchased this product it has been grayish-white with a light scent.
  1735. i just started using this product to make eczema cream for my son. i had several questions along the way and am very happy to say that the gal at this company responded immediately. wow! that hardly ever happens, right :-). anyway she answered my questions and off and running i am. i have ordered another batch and just got done making my christmas presents (hello whipped lavender/ lemongrass body and hair cream). thank you for helping me make lovely products for my skin that are natural.

Take note that this butter is higher priced because it's organic, but it's not certified organic. Although this is certainly a great butter, as I've said, I'm not sure it's that much better to justify the price.

  2100. new to using pure shea butter (trying to phase out chemically lotions in my life.) Its not as greasy as coconut oil. Its thick but rubs into the skin pretty easily. It smells like a bunch of peanuts sat by a camp fire for awhile. My recipe is 4oz of this (weighed on scale) melted in a double boiler with 1.4oz coconut oil and then I put some essential oils in to kill the smell. Mix until all is liquid, put in fridge s it firms up again, then when cool whip with hand blender. I have found that lighter oils like floral , and fruity don't mask the smoked smell enough. Mixing pepper mint, tea tree, eucalyptus and lemon oils makes this smell fresh and feel tingly / refreshing on the skin. It feels more greasy than regular lotion when you rub in. After about an hour its pretty much absorbed. The next day when I wake up my skin feels soooo good and hydrated and feels that way until I shower and even after when I put more on. I'll never go back to regular store bought lotion. im loving garden of edensgarden.com for essential oils ( hint 6 pack pick your own usually comes out cheaper than singles) back to this shea though.. It came pretty quickly in the mail. So far petty satisfied. I just keep the block in a large ziplock and squeeze pull pieces off as needed
  2101. This is he most amazing she's butter I have found. It is silky smooth!!

It is very thick and if you're using it straight off of the block (without warming it) it does take a bit of encouragement to melt it down yourself. However whether you do it that way or warm it to soften, when applied to the skin it is silky smooth and instantly feels hydrating. So far my child with the more mild eczema has shown such improvement, the little dry patches are visible but I can't feel them anymore, which is huge progress. (It's been less than a week!) Anyone who deals with eczema knows what I mean. The child who has severe eczema and has more rashy skin than dry patches is also showing improvement but a little slower which I anticipated. Trying to hydrate the skin enough that it isn't so itchy so that the rashes have a chance to diminish is a process, however the fact I have a product I can now apply with no crying or discomfort whatsoever is huge.   2368. I don't think this is truly pure shea butter. First of all it's the consistency of packed brown sugar. Very granular. I've never seen shea butter like that. Secondly, the &#34;ivory&#34; version is not ivory. It's a pale yellow. Makes me think they blended it with another butter (whatever that darker yellow stuff is). Lastly, it's oily and greasy, leaves a serious shine which other true shea butters I've used do not do. Others I've used absorb well and just leave a bit of a glow, like if you use it on your legs it should make the skin look bright not shimmery/oily. I also have used pure unrefined shea butter on my face before but I would never want to put this stuff on my face. This product went straight in the trash.

In some places I stay the temperature is 60 degrees, so I put some under my arms, on my face, and then my leg. I go back and rub it in because my body warms it quickly.
